narrative.narrative: Air Jamaica Express was a subsidiary of Air Jamaica that operated from April 18,1996 to October 14,2005. It started in 1973 as Jamaica Air Taxi, and then it was called Trans-Jamaican Airline. In 1994 the owner of Air Jamaica, Gordon Stewart, took it over and turned it into a subsidiary of Air Jamaica and commenced operations in April 1996. Its base was Kingston. It flew to other domestic airports at Montego Bay,Negril,Ocho Rios and Port Antonio. It also went to George Town,Cayman Islands and Havana,Cuba all year. Seasonal ones were Nassau,Bahamas Santo Domingo,Dominican Republic Port-au-Prince,Haiti Santiago,Cuba and Providenciales,Turks and Caicos. Its fleet in 2002 was six 37 passenger Bombardier Dash 8-100's and two DH Twin Otters for 19 people. Britten Norman Islanders and Trislanders had been used in the past as well.

prefereds.aircrafts: Bombardier Dash 8-100,DHC-6-100 Twin Otter,BN-2A Islander,BN Trislander
